text:
Brookville is a city in Saline County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 262 people lived there.
History.
Brookville was planned out in 1870 when the Kansas Pacific Railway was built to that point. The first post office in Brookville was created in February 1870.
Geography.
Brookville is at (38.773464, -97.868015). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
Climate.
Brookville has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The Köppen Climate Classification system says that Brookville has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.
People.
It is part of the Salina Micropolitan Statistical Area.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 262 people, 101 households, and 72 families living in Brookville.
2000 census.
The 2000 census says that there were 259 people, 104 households, and 74 families living in Brookville.
Education.
Brookville is a part of USD 307 Ell-Saline.
In popular culture.
One scene of the 1980 film "Up the Academy" was filmed in Brookville, where the boys drive off without paying for fuel.
